ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BOHBJ:ref
Subject: Existing Bluetooth Devices getting greyed out    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BOHBJ:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Manpreet,

The greyed out bluetooth devices suggest they are either disconnected from the client machine or possibly blocked (as specific devices) from Device Control > device rights settings.
If any issue persists let me know your timezone and availability for a Zoom session.

Thank you and Best regards,
Alin

TextBody:
Hi Manpreet,

Meanwhile we determined this is a known issue.
We have a test build containing a fix:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp12032024/EPPMac3.0.3.0002.Notarized.zip
Please note this is just a test build if you'd like to confirm that it fixes the issue on a test machine. It is not meant to be deployed globally, it's just for testing purposes.
The official fix is targeted for the next 5.9.4.0 epp release.

Best Regards,
Alin

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #410842 - Existing Bluetooth Devices getting greyed out    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BOHBJ:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Manpreet,

This test build is not an official build, hence our QA validation is not complete yet, and it should not be deployed to large groups. It was created specifically to fix this issue.
I provided it in case you'd like to test the fix on a test machine.
As discussed, the official fix is targeted for the next 5.9.4.0 epp release, and that will be the agent build to use in production.

Best Regards,
Alin

Hi Manpreet,

Meanwhile we determined this is a known issue.
We have a test build containing a fix:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp12032024/EPPMac3.0.3.0002.Notarized.zip
Please note this is just a test build if you'd like to confirm that it fixes the issue on a test machine. It is not meant to be deployed globally, it's just for testing purposes.
The official fix is targeted for the next 5.9.4.0 epp release.

Best Regards,
Alin
